COCOA: The dried and partially fermented fatty seeds of the cacao tree from which chocolate is made.
CRANBERRY: A shrub belonging to the section Vaccinium sect. Oxycoccus of the genus Vaccinium.
GINGERBREAD: A type of cake whose main flavoring is ginger.
PEPPERMINT: A hybrid herb of the mint family (Mentha × piperita), formed by crossing watermint and spearmint, which has a high menthol content and a sharp flavor and is used in cooking, especially in herb teas and in confections.
